Package projects.phonebook

Class Phonebook

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.phonebook.Phonebook
  • public class Phonebook
extends java.lang.Object

    Phonebook is an abstraction over phonebooks: databases of < Full Name, Phone Number> pairs. It allows for both phone and name search, both in amortized constant time. The efficiency of either search will be dependent on the nature of the underlying hash table. No null entries are allowed.

    Phonebook only allows for unique Person / Phone pairs. That is, every person will have exactly one phone number associated with them, and every phone number will be associated with exactly one person. Study the implementation of this class to see for yourselves how this is attained by interfacing with both internal hash tables.

    The Release Tests on the submit server primarily test the methods of Phonebook Since Phonebook's methods rely on methods of HashTable instances, by parameterizing Phonebook instances in all 3^2 = 9 possible ways, we can run the same tests against all of the hash tables that you will have to implement.

    **** STUDY, BUT DO NOT EDIT THIS CLASS' SOURCE CODE!

    Author:
    Jason Filippou
    See Also:
    HashTable, SeparateChainingHashTable, LinearProbingHashTable, QuadraticProbingHashTable

    • Constructor Detail

      • Phonebook

        public Phonebook​(CollisionResolver namesToNumbersHash,
                 CollisionResolver numbersToNamesHash)
        Instantiates a new Phonebook. The parameters provide the collision resolution strategy for lookups based on name or number, respectively.
        Parameters:
        namesToNumbersHash - A CollisionResolver that will govern which subtype of HashTable will be used to create our hash table with peoples' names as keys.
        numbersToNamesHash - A CollisionResolver that will govern which subtype of HashTable will be used to create our hash table with phone numbers as keys.
        See Also:
        CollisionResolver

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOf

        public java.lang.String getNumberOf​(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves the phone number associated with the provided full name. If the name is not in the database, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        name - The full name of the owner of the phone number that is being searched for.
        Returns:
        The phone number associated with name, or null if name is null or if name is not in the Phonebook.

      • getOwnerOf

        public java.lang.String getOwnerOf​(java.lang.String number)
        Retrieves the full name of the owner of the provided phone number. If the phone number is not in the database, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        number - The phone number whose owner is being searched for.
        Returns:
        The full name of the owner of number, or null if number is null or if number is not in the Phonebook.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry​(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String number)
        Adds the tuple < name, number > in the Phonebook. If either name or number are already in the collection, then the entire entry is updated.
        Parameters:
        name - The full name of the number's owner.
        number - The phone number of the person.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either name or number is null.

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry​(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String number)
        Deletes the entry characterized by the arguments provided. If either argument is null, or if the entry is not contained by this Phonebook instance, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        name - The "owner" part of the < owner, phone number > tuple.
        number - The "number" part of the < owner, phone number > tuple.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either name or number is null.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of entries in the phonebook.
        Returns:
        the number of entries in the phonebook.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Queries the phonebook for emptiness.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, there are 0 entries in this Phonebook, false otherwise.
